name: Brydging Ring
tagline: Wild, pathless woods choked with brambles and knee-height, blue-flowered thistles.

procedural.foraging_results: Successful foraging yields 1d3 portions of Hogscap (DPB) or Prancing Mandrake (p430), in addition to the normal results

description: Wild, pathless woods choked with brambles and knee-height, blue-flowered thistles.

points_of_interest.name: Standing Stones
points_of_interest.description: 300 yards from the southern edge of this hex, through an area overgrown with brambles, stands a ring of tall stones, clad with white-leafed ivy.
points_of_interest.interior: At the centre of the ring is a mound of human remainsâ€”primarily bones, but possibly a fresher corpse as well, rended limb from limb. No clothing or equipment is to be found. Weatherworn runes beneath the ivy are in a language lost to the utmost antiquity. If deciphered, the runes reveal litanies of praise to nameless entities, detailing awful, gruesome rituals.
points_of_interest.exploring: Examining the stones reveals weatherworn runes beneath the ivy. They are in a language lost to the utmost antiquity. If deciphered, the runes reveal litanies of praise to nameless entities, detailing awful, gruesome rituals.
points_of_interest.inhabitants: The remains are those of captives regularly sacrificed here by a group of 7 antler wraiths (DMB).
special_features: Cursed place: Locals know this place as Brydging Ring and speak of it as a place accursed and bewitched

points_of_interest.name: The Wraiths' Hoard
points_of_interest.description: Some way to the east of the standing stones, in a shadowed glade, is an ominous boulder, under which lie buried the clothing and possessions of the victims of the 7 antler wraiths that haunt the stones.
points_of_interest.interior: Coins: 4,980cp, 1,023sp, 993gp. Jewellery: A silver ring engraved with a wyrm (30gp); a silver pendant shaped like a mermaid, with pearls for breasts (1,400gp); a platinum locket with a portrait of Lord Malbleat (400gp). A belt of shining fish skin: A Belt of Blending (p406).
special_features: Digging under the boulder summons the wraiths within 1 Turn

points_of_interest.name: The Nymph Pool
points_of_interest.description: A small pool of placid, pink-tinged water, hidden in a bramble-choked dell.
points_of_interest.interior: In spring and summer: Twelve nymph statues stand in the water at the pool's edge, depicted joyously splashing on another. In autumn and winter: Twelve nymph statues stand in the trees around the pool, depicted gazing mournfully at the ground, their eyes pointedly averted from the pool.
special_features: In spring and summer: Bathing in the pool cures a magical affliction (e.g. a curse, Ability Score loss, energy drain)
In autumn and winter: Bathing in the pool permanently halves a random Ability Score
Each character can only be affected by the pool's magic once per season
